# Create a Call API method

==Description==
  * *Authorization Level:* require_guest


==Parameters==
<table cellpadding="2" style="background-color:#E0FFFF; border:1px solid #48D1CC; margin: 0px; width: 100%">
|| *Required* || *Name* || *Type* || *Description* ||
|| required || callerJabberId || jid || Jabber ID of the caller initiating the call ||
|| || callerName || string || Name of the caller initiating the call ||
|| optional || persistent || boolean  || True if this callid should remain valid past the normal 4 day timeout ||
|| || features || string || This parameter has been added to allow for future additions to the Create Call API method. For now the best value to pass is simply an empty string. ||
</table>

==Error Codes==
<table cellpadding="2" style="background-color:#FFC0CB; border:1px solid #CD5C5C; margin: 0px;">
|| *Code* || *Exception* || *Description* ||
|| 401 || UnauthorizedUserException || You are not authorized to make requests as userid ###. Authorized as ####. ||
</table>

==Return Syntax==
{{{ 
<tokResult>
     <createCall callerJabberId="######@jabber.dev.tokbox.com" callerName="A Name" persistent="false">
          <callId>6qffexe8gwhbowty</callId>
          <server>76.74.154.35/tokbox</server>
     </createCall>
     <serverInformation>
          <address>76.74.154.35</address>
          <name>sandbox.tokbox.com</name>
          <userAgent>N/A</userAgent>
          <remoteAddress>76.74.154.35</remoteAddress>
          <requestURI>/calls/create</requestURI>
     </serverInformation>
     <partner key="####"/>
     <timer startTime="1222156462.2402" execTime="35.207986831665"/>
</tokResult>
}}}
==Notes==
  * The {callerName} is used to notify users who are invited as to who is inviting them.
  * After creating a call, use [CreateInvite Create Invite] to invite any party you wish to join the call.
